Description: Shoulder sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery amphora; exterior: above, trace of band in added red at junction of neck and shoulder; below, black-figure decoration consisting of bridled horse to right (part of head, forelock, eye, snout, muzzle, chin and rein with traces of dots in added white for bridle remaining).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Cook suggests that the painter of this vase is the same as the one who painted Oxford AN1896-1908.G.130.8 and AN1896-1908.G.130.7 based on the manner in which the manes are depicted. 'c' added in pencil to registration number on rear.
Bibliographic references: Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 137, no. 6) (labelled 1912.33 (c))
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.040) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
